data.name: CausalTables.jl
data.description: A new type of Table to store and simulate data for causal inference in Julia.

evidence: README mentions binaries/installers: "To simulate data, one must first define a `StructuralCausalModel` (SCM). An SCM is composed of a `DataGeneratingProcess`, which is a sequence of random variables, along with labels for treatment, resp"

"The goal of `CausalTables.jl` is to simplify the development of statistical causal inference methods in Julia. To this end, the package provides two sets of tools" (describes a Julia package with programmatic interfaces, implying use as a dependency).

"CausalTables.jl can be installed using the Julia package manager. From the Julia REPL, type `]` to enter the Pkg REPL mode and run `Pkg> add CausalTables`" (installation via Juliaâ€™s package registry).
